content.description: Up a broken crack to horizontal crack. Face climbing up cracks to a high bolt. Finish up at top of final headwall.
content.protection: Small to medium gear, 1 bolt, 2 bolt anchors
content.location: Obvious broken crack on East face of Bobcat Boulder. To the right side prior to turning the corner to The Loaf.

content.description: Climb a seam to a crack to a ledge on the far right side of the face. Shift to a face climb to the right side arete.
content.location: The larger crack right of Snakes are Poodles Too.

content.description: True to its namesake, the crack is loose and crumbly which can make it a bit tricky for a beginner trad leader (don't use cams).  Climb the left diagonal cracks up to a ledge with a Palo Verde tree.  Belay from the tree and/or walk off to the west.  There are also a set of rap anchors above on the wall a few yards to the north near Snakes Are Poodles Too
content.protection: Due to the crumbly rock, use stoppers/nuts and not cams.
content.location: Follow the easy-looking leftward leaning diagonal cracks on the southeast corner of Bobcat Boulder.

content.description: A fun, easy, but short sport route on Bobcat Boulder.  Climb the face past 2 bolts to a small roof.  Clip the 3rd bolt at the roof and continue upward on the slightly runout slab to the ledge and a Palo Verde tree.  Walk off to west or rap down using the rap station up on the wall a few yards to the north near Snakes Are Poodles Too.
content.protection: 3 bolts, sling a tree for belay or walk off.
content.location: The sport route with 3 bolts on the southeast corner of Bobcat Boulder, just to the left of the mixed route Crystaline Grin (5.10c).

climbs.name: Crystalline Grin
climbs.fa: ?? if you know let me know.

content.description: Thin face moves past 2 bolts on the lower face leads to a brake in the rock.  From here move right into a crack system and end on a ledge with a small tree for belay.
content.protection: few draws and a set of cams.
content.location: Just to the left of boulders.  Walk off.

content.description: Good Granite climbing with out the crowds.  Do not climb here in  the Summer it is too hot.
